summary: This is a stipulation filed in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330) in the Southern District of New York. The parties agree that a transcript of a November 6, 2009 deposition taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, is authentic and may be admitted as evidence at trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case S2 20 CR 330. The stipulation is filed on her behalf by her attorneys.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is a signatory to this stipulation on behalf of the government.

events.title: Deposition in West Palm Beach
events.description: A deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this deposition is marked as document 3506-001.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The prosecution and defense stipulate to the authenticity of a 2009 deposition transcript and its admissibility as evidence at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

keyFacts: The document is a stipulation agreeing that a transcript from a November 6, 2009 deposition in West Palm Beach, Florida, is authentic.
The stipulation is from November 2021, filed in Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case (S2 20 CR 330).
The deposition transcript is marked as Government Exhibit 1006 and is admissible as evidence at trial.
Ghislaine Maxwell is represented by attorneys Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, Damian Williams, is a signatory for the prosecution.
